atlantic.title: Stock Buybacks Are Killing the American Economy
atlantic.topComment: I've never heard of this before, so I can't claim to have analyzed it fully, but intuitively, the writer's idea makes sense to me.

atlantic.title: Complaining, for Your Health
atlantic.topComment:
Everything is better with mindfulness! If you complain and you're mindful, you become aware of the situation and, more
importantly, how your thoughts and feelings about it are causing you pain, and you can realize the harmful and contingent nature of...

atlantic.title: What I Learned Trying to Write a Muslim-American Cop Show for HBO
atlantic.topComment: What I've learned from writing crime novels is that the character is the reason you write the book, but the plot is what really drives the thing. Editors or producers or networks will primarily consider the plot, rather than the character, to be "the...
